subject: Re: [junit] How to Test Private Methods Inside a Class
msgSnippet: ... Indeed, true. Cedric, what you describe is how protected works in C++. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info Your guide to software
messageBody:
Joakim Ohlrogge wrote:
>
>
> Hi Cederic,
>
> > > Not true, this is a common mussunderstanding, protected is /less/
> > > restricted than package private
> >
> > Can you expand on that? A protected method can only be used from a
> subclass
> > while a package private method can be called from *any* class in that
> > package.
>
> I meant exactly what I wrote and, no it does not work as you think. It
> is a common missunderstanding. Protected methods can be used from
> *any* method in the same package *and* from subclasses derived from
> the class declaring the protected member.

Indeed, true. Cedric, what you describe is how protected works in C++.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
